content: But in terms of control, we believed in the great moderation; we were wrong. Now we’re probably wrong again. You have people like Jeremy Stein, who are convinced the Fed shouldn’t be holding rates down, people like Paul Krugman, who are more or less convinced they should have been. And given that we cannot rerun alternate histories, I don’t think statistics simply getting better will ever settle a lot of these key questions. So economics will always be hovering between art and science.
